result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanner S Bowden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY WOOD COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.

Counseling deemed necessary.

No contact with victim, B.L.W., and residence.

No unsupervised contact with anyone under age 18, except for siblings.

Defendant must comply with the sex offender registry.  Defendant is required to register as a sex offender for 15 years after his discharge from supervision.  

DNA sample must be provided within 30 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tanner S Bowden

from DOC re: term of sex offender registry.

Court orders clerk to amend JOC to require sex offender register for 15 years after discharge from supervision.

9:08 AM Defendant Tanner S Bowden appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney George Andrew Limbeck in court for Tanner S Bowden.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin.
Revoking Bond with WCSD Report

1:36 PM Defendant Tanner S Bowden appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Laura Federico in court for defendant. Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Wood County Jail is requesting that defendant be removed from EMP due to new charges. Attorney Federico asks Court to allow defendant to remain in EMP.
Court revokes bond.
Sentencing hearing on July 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:05 AM Defendant Tanner S Bowden in court.  Attorney George Andrew Limbeck in court for Tanner S Bowden.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Zima gives the court her sentencing recommendation. Attorney Limbeck is requesting to do a plea today and then schedule a sentencing hearing. Court grants. No contest plea is entered. Bond is continued and this matter will be set for a sentencing hearing.

No contact with victim or residence, except for incidental contact. BLW. Be fitted for GPS, follow all EMP Rules, only allowed to go  to school and home without permission. Must have written permission for anything else. $20,000

No contact w/victim or their residence except for incidental contact - BLW. Be fitted w/ GPS monitor by the jail and wear it until further order of the court. Follow all EMP rules and only allowed to go to school and his home without express permission. Must have written permission for anything else.
1:38 PM Defendant Tanner S Bowden appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney George Andrew Limbeck in court for Tanner S Bowden.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing on May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Dan McGrath appears for the state of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video in custody from the Wood County Jail.  Court will wait to hear the matter until defendant's attorney, Atty Limbeck, is available.

10:38 AM Defendant Tanner S Bowden in court.  Attorney George Andrew Limbeck in court for Tanner S Bowden.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin.
Final pre-trial scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
